availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles C. M. Walter (Washington County, District of Columbia, Justice of the peace and commissioner of deeds)

body.p: Washington County, District of Columbia, Justice of the peace and commissioner of deeds. Native of WÃ¼rttemberg. Married to Ellen C. Mohun Walter in Washington D.C. on March 11, 1847. Father of Catherine Pauline Walter and Charles A. Walter. Professor of Music in Washington D.C. in 1850. Justice of the peace in Washington D. C. in 1860. Commissioner of Deeds in Washington D. C. in 1862. Justice of the peace in Washington D. C. in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, District of Columbia, Washington County, Washington City, Ward 4, p. 302B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, District of Columbia, Washington County, Washington City, Ward 4, p. 292.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, District of Columbia, Washington County, Washington City, Ward 4, p. 646B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Washington County, District of Columbia, June and July 1863, p. 478.

"Charles Walter (1824-1894)," Find A Grave, Memorial #69281364, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69281364 (accessed July 19, 2021).
